question: The blonde over there, she's too gorgeous for words. Just look at those eyes, look at those shoulders and the way she moves. I'm in love. Here, take over, I'll be right back. Hello. I'm the captain of this plane. May I ask your name? Listen, Jane, I've seen many beautiful women in my life but I swear to you, I've never, ever met a woman as exquisite as you are. Jack kneels down before her, and the Girl looks at him, amused. He takes her hand and places it over his heart. Jane, can you feel my heart? It's pounding. This is horrible, I think I'm gonna faint. Listen I'm putting my fate in your hands. If you don't call me, you'll make me the most miserable man on earth. This is no line and I'm not trying to get you into bed. This is something completely different. I love you Jane and if you call me I'll be the happiest man in the entire universe -- this is 'love at first sight.' Out of all these beautiful women I noticed only you, and... The Girl laughs as Jack goes on. Meanwhile, the Busi- nessman who was seated in the rear of the plane has gotten up and walked over to Jack.
answer: Are you Paul?

question: No, I'm not.
answer: But you're the pilot, aren't you?

question: Yes, I'm the pilot... ... I'm not even asking for your phone number...
answer: Isn't there a pilot whose name is Paul?

question: Yeah, the copilot -- he's up front... The Businessman disappears in the direction of the cockpit. I'm leaving it all up to you, Jane, but if you do give me your phone number, then Jane, then... The Businessman has reached the cockpit.
answer: Are you Paul?

question: Are you Paul?
answer: Yeah... Are you Jim?

question: Yeah. He hands Paul a man's purse. Here's your cash.
answer: What about the stuff?

question: I don't have it. We've got problems. Too much heat. Too
answer: Whadda ya mean us? You mean me?

question: I mean shut up and listen. Two guys will be waiting for you in a black T-Bird, expecting the dope. Just ignore them. It'll be delivered to you on Sunday and picked up the following Thursday, okay?
answer: But I won't be home, I'll be in the air for two weeks.

question: That's your problem. Make arrangements, a deal's a deal. Got it!?
answer: Got it. Jack returns.

question: Listen, I need a favor, I got
answer: Yeah, sure... Hey, look, will you -- look at that sparkling beauty.

question: Yeah... I mean, it's like... There's this little package...
answer: She'll never make it with all that luggage she's got. I gotta give her a hand. Look at the colors in her hair! Christ, I've never seen a woman like her before... He's about to walk off when Paul grabs him by the arm.

question: Jack, listen, can I...
answer: Sure you can, no problem... Listen, I gotta go now, I'm gonna see if she'll share a cab with me. You take the shuttle, okay?

question: But I gotta explain to you about...
answer: Come over to my place tonight. We're having a huge party. Come around 9, okay? See ya later. As exquisite as you are... I think I'm gonna faint. He kneels, takes her hand and puts it over his heart. The young woman is flabbergasted. A lonely-looking Paul hails the shuttle bus. This is no line and I'm not trying to get you into bed. This is something completely different. This is 'love at first sight.' Oh, I'm so happy... Let me go get you a glass of champagne. I'll be right back. Jack gets up and goes over to the buffet. As soon as he's out of the girl's line of sight, he starts running toward the other end of the apartment. On the way he passes MICHAEL, who's deeply engrossed in a vehement conversation about modern art with a girl called SOPHIA. They're fighting like cats and dogs but seem to be enjoy- ing it.

question: Come over to my place tonight. We're having a huge party. Come around 9, okay? See ya later. As exquisite as you are... I think I'm gonna faint. He kneels, takes her hand and puts it over his heart. The young woman is flabbergasted. A lonely-looking Paul hails the shuttle bus. This is no line and I'm not trying to get you into bed. This is something completely different. This is 'love at first sight.' Oh, I'm so happy... Let me go get you a glass of champagne. I'll be right back. Jack gets up and goes over to the buffet. As soon as he's out of the girl's line of sight, he starts running toward the other end of the apartment. On the way he passes MICHAEL, who's deeply engrossed in a vehement conversation about modern art with a girl called SOPHIA. They're fighting like cats and dogs but seem to be enjoy- ing it.
answer: It goes back to prehistoric man. They had comic strips on their walls, for God's sake.

question: I'm having a hard time. I'm working on two at once.
answer: Oh yeah, who?

question: The brunette in the armchair in the living room -- her name's Rosalie... Clementine -- she's waiting for me in the den.
answer: Wait one second for me, I'll be right back. Michael walks off in the direction of Rosalie. Paul is wandering among the guests, trying to find Jack, he sees PETER who is talking with another young woman, NICOLE. Peter is nodding, idly looking around, com- pletely uninterested in the conversation.

question: What?... Oh, the rent... yeah, it's high but split between the three of us it isn't that bad, as long as we don't eat. Nicole laughs.
answer: Hi Peter, I'm looking for Jack, have you seen him?

question: Oh hi, Paul, how are you doing? Yeah, sure, I'll take you to Jack. Excuse me for a minute. They move away. You're a lifesaver, I've been trying to get away from that woman
answer: Wait -- What about Jack?

question: Jack, can I talk to you for a second?
answer: Oh, hi, Paul, yeah sure... ... Please darling, don't move... I'll be right back, okay? I'll bring us back some champagne... He disappears with Paul. You're a lifesaver, Paul. I thought I'd never get away. Rosalie's waiting for me in the living room. Isn't she terrific?

question: Who? Rosalie?
answer: Clementine.

question: Oh yeah, for sure, I dunno. Listen, can you do me a favor? With some difficulty, Paul follows Jack as he picks his way through the people dancing, heading in Rosalie's direction.
answer: Yeah... What kind of favor? Damn, I've got to get her a glass of champagne.

question: Listen, I've got a little problem. I'm having a valuable package delivered to me on Sunday, but I'm not going to be home. I've got to do the Hawaii-Tahiti-Australia route, so can I have the package delivered here instead?
answer: Yeah, sure, of course. No, wait, I'm leaving for South America tomorrow. I'll be gone for three weeks. But it's okay. Peter and Michael will be here. They'll take care of it.

question: Will you be sure to tell them about it?
answer: Absolutely. Don't worry about a thing.

question: It'll be delivered Sunday and picked up next Thursday, okay?
answer: Delivered Sunday picked up Thursday. Got it. No problem.

question: This is a very delicate matter, Jack. It's very important they don't tell anybody about this package. It could be very... uh, embarrassing for me, you know what I'm saying?
answer: Sure. You got it. I'll see you later...

question: Not to anyone at all. Tell them that, okay?
answer: Okay, sure, not to anyone at all... Look, I'm sorry Paul, but I gotta get back to Rosalie. Now go have a good time. I'll take care of everything.

question: Bye and thanks a lot.
answer: Don't mention it. Paul leaves. Jack finally reaches the armchair where Rosalie is sitting. He stops short, obviously disappointed. Uh-oh. Too late. Michael is sitting next to Rosalie, right next to her. They get up to dance. As he passes Jack, Michael smiles broadly.

question: Good night, Carl... I'll call you Sunday, Natalie. She has already left. The door closes on the last of the departing guests.
answer: So you struck out again with Natalie, huh? That Carl is a real smooth operator.

question: He's an asshole! 'I heard you're not ready yet.' 'We're gonna kick your ass.' Well, we may be behind schedule, but we're still going to beat that sonofabitch and maybe I haven't scored with Natalie yet, but neither has he. She's not an easy lay, that's what I like about her. You know what they say
answer: Well, I didn't do so well either -- I blew it with Rosalie. I don't even know how...

question: Who's Rosalie?
answer: That beauty I managed to swipe

question: Your old friend Sophia appeared and got you involved in a thrilling conversation about modern art, and meanwhile Rosalie...
answer: How could you know that?

question: Michael, all you want to do is steal Jack's girl friends. You don't give a shit about the women themselves...
answer: That's not true. It's just that Sophia drives me crazy. She knows all the right buttons to push to make me mad.

question: Anyway, it was a great party, everyone had a good time...
answer: Terrific... time. He, too, leaves the living room and runs into Jack, who has his arm around Clementine's waist as he heads toward his bedroom with her.

question: Where's Jack? Did he leave?
answer: No, he's cuddling up with a blonde named Clementine...

question: That's not Clementine. I saw him doing his famous routine with Christie...
answer: No, it is Clementine, the one with the tits this big...

question: Christie's got tits that big, too...
answer: Yeah, but he was with Christie at the beginning of the evening -- after that he was with Rosalie and then with Clementine. And since I stole Rosalie away from him... Are you following this?

question: I'm not. Jack enters the kitchen in very high spirits, singing.
answer: Nice work if you can get it, and you can get it if you try... Any scotch left?

question: Yeah, here, I just put it away.
answer: Sorry I can't give you guys a hand, but I've got something cooking.

question: I thought you were leaving at dawn for South America?
answer: I am, the night's still young!... It's gonna be a lively one. I'm gonna make us a little snack. He makes up a tray with sandwiches.

question: I am, the night's still young!... It's gonna be a lively one. I'm gonna make us a little snack. He makes up a tray with sandwiches.
answer: So, who is it anyway -- Christie or Clementine?

question: Maxine. Beautiful, enchanting Maxine. Peter and Michael look at one another surprised, mouthing silently, "Maxine?" Hey, Michael -- how'd it go with Rosalie?
answer: Well, things were going great until...

question: Your old friend Sophia appeared and dragged you into a thrilling conversation about modern art and in the meantime Rosalie took off with someone else.
answer: How did you know?

question: I dunno -- lucky guess...
answer: Well, I don't give a damn anyway, I have 24 drawings to hand in to my editor three days from now and I gotta work all night anyway... So it was all for the best. But you better not leave that Maxine's phone number lying around because when I'm done...

question: Come on, Jerry... A SECRETARY enters. I'm not in. Hi... yeah... listen, make it quick, I'm in a meeting here... yeah, a package... okay... someone'll drop it off Sunday and pick it up Thursday... No problem ... yeah... we'll put it aside, okay... no, no, we won't tell anybody about it... Is that it?... Right, we won't tell anyone... Hey -- love 'n' kisses to the Brazilian girls, vaya con dios, old buddy. Peter hangs up, laughing. Jerry gives him a dirty look. What? I'm going out for bagels -- how many you want, three or four?
answer: What time is it?

question: Eleven-thirty.
answer: A.M. or P.M.?

question: A.M. C'mon, up 'n' at 'em.
answer: Up 'n' at 'em yourself, asshole -- I just went to bed. Nah, I didn't get anywhere.

question: Well then... nap time's over. Back to work. So how many bagels, three or four?
answer: Six, six! He buries his head under the pillow.

question: You gotta be kidding! Abruptly he turns and races back to Michael's room. Michael! Michael!
answer: What?

question: Get your ass out here and see what's on the doorstep. This has gotta be somebody's idea of a joke! They run to the front door.
answer: What is it?

question: Look for yourself.
answer: It's a basket with a baby in it.

question: No shit. 'Dearest Jack, here is the fruit of our love. Take good care of her. I have to go to Europe and Japan for six months, her name is Mary. Good luck, Love, Sylvia.'
answer: What are we going to do with it?

question: Give it back to her mother, that's what.
answer: But it says she went to Europe.

question: Well, we'll see about that, d'you have her phone number?
answer: Whose phone number?

question: Why the hell would I have her number? I've never even heard of this chick!
answer: You mean you don't know who she is?

question: No way. If I had to keep track of all Jack's girlfriends, I'd have to be a full-time secretary.
answer: Well, what are we gonna do?

question: Hey, look, she's waking up... Hey, look, she's crying...
answer: Oh no, this can't be happening! She's not gonna start to cry now?! What's her problem?

question: Maybe she's hungry?
answer: Well, what are we s'posed to do?

question: Feed her, I guess...
answer: Yeah, but what?

question: Soft stuff... I guess.
answer: Oh no, I swear to God this is unreal! Can you believe that bastard Jack?! 'A little package,' he tells me on the phone, 'just put it aside till Thursday.' Put it aside -- can you believe him!?

question: Really? Jack said that?
answer: Yeah and he also said 'don't tell anyone about it -- anyone at all.'

question: Oh, so he told you about this?
answer: Yeah, he told me a package would be coming today, but he didn't say it'd be this!

question: Boy, he's got a helluva nerve!
answer: Just listen to the racket she's making! What are we s'posed to do?

question: Let's call Jack's mother!
answer: She lives in Miami for Christsake. She can't stop the baby crying from Miami.

question: Well, just to ask her advice...
answer: No, he said not to tell anyone...

question: But this is an emergency!
answer: No! No way! You know what a pain that woman is -- she'll be on the next plane here to move in with us...

question: Maybe I should call my mother...
answer: No, please -- leave the mothers out of this, okay?! It's only four days. We should be able to handle that, besides you know the rule around here And that includes mothers! Peter steps over the basket and heads towards the elevator.

question: Where are you going?!
answer: I'm going to the store to buy some baby food.

question: What am I supposed to do while you're gone?
answer: Pick her up and hold her.

question: Whaddya mean, pick her up? I've never held a baby -- I'll drop her!
answer: What aisle's baby food on?

question: Okay, okay, don't cry like that... I'll hold you, I'll hold you. He tries rather unsuccessfully to wrap the towel around the child. Obviously Michael is very put off by the smell coming from Mary.
answer: So what's the best brand?

question: So what's the best brand?
answer: Depends on what your pediatrician recommends.

question: Oh right, the pediatrician... But which one sells the most?
answer: This kind.

question: Oh, so this is the best kind?
answer: It's the cheapest.

question: Then it's the worst kind?
answer: They're all good, sir.

question: Oh, okay, then I can take this kind.
answer: It's got iron in it.

question: Oh. Is that good or bad?
answer: It's very good.

question: Well, why don't they all have iron in them?
answer: Some babies are allergic to iron.

question: Oh, okay, well I'll take this kind then.
answer: That kind doesn't have any milk in it.

question: Oh, I see, there's milk with no milk in it?
answer: Some babies are allergic to milk.

question: So what's the stuff that no babies are allergic to?
answer: Soy formula.

question: Oh, okay, I'll take the soy formula.
answer: That one's Advance.

question: Oh really? What's Advance?
answer: How old's your baby?

question: No, actually they had to leave unexpectedly. They had to catch a plane...
answer: Is she teething?

question: Teething?
answer: Does she drool? Does she cry all night long? Does she chew on her fists? Does she put everything into her mouth? She acts out her words.

question: I know she can't talk. I told you they had to leave unexpectedly.
answer: Or else you could weigh her; that would tell you how old she is.

question: So what about me? What should I buy?
answer: Didn't they even tell you the pediatrician's name?

question: No. They didn't.
answer: You sure have weird friends.

question: Mary had a little lamb, little lamb, little lamb, if that jerk isn't back in three seconds I swear I'll throw her down the garbage chute... Mary had a little lamb, little lamb... The DOORBELL RINGS. Well, it's about goddamn time! He hurries towards the door, grabs the knob and throws it open. Where the hell have you been? He stops. Before him stands the apartment MANAGER, Mrs. Razzolini, a squat little woman with a moustache. Oh -- Hi, Mrs. Razzolini!
answer: This package came for you... Oh! What a cute little baby! Is it yours?

question: No, it's not me, I mean she's not mine...
answer: Oh, so it's Peter's?

question: No, no, it's Jack's, I mean it's not Jack's, it's... someone loaned it to us, I mean someone...
answer: And what's the little girl's name?

question: Mary.
answer: Ooh, what a pwetty wittle name, Mary! I didn't know you had a baby...

question: Yeah, well, I have to put her to bed now.
answer: You have to put her to bed? Where's Mary's mommy?

question: She's... she's not here. She'll be back soon. Michael starts to close the door. She pushes it back open and holds out the package.
answer: Oh here, this just came for you. They just dropped it off. Can I hold her for a second?

question: Well, like, y'see... she doesn't like to be held by strangers... The apartment Manager has already given Michael the package and grabbed Mary. She covers her with kisses. Mary smiles. Michael absent-mindedly looks at the package.
answer: She loves to be held by strangers! Hey, she's soaking wet hmm, no I think it's number 2. Want me to give you a hand changing her?

question: Oh no, don't worry, I'm used to it. Well, so long, Mrs. Razzolini.
answer: 'Bye, Mary, I'll come back to visit.

question: What the hell were you doing? You've been gone for hours! This damn kid's been crying the whole time. I've got a lot better things to do with my time! You're a real pain in the ass!
answer: Hey, how dare you speak to me like that! You've never spoken to me like that before...

question: Well, what the hell took you so long? What'd you do, go out for breakfast or something? I didn't even have time for a cup of coffee, for chrissakes.
answer: Will you please cut it out for a second, huh? I didn't have any coffee either, it took me forever at the goddamn Safeway.

question: Okay, well, here -- take the kid, I've got work to do.
answer: Whaddaya mean, take the kid? I can't hold her and make her bottle at the same time. And why should I be the one to hold her?

question: 'Cause, it's your problem. You found this kid.
answer: Hey, asshole, I'm the one who found

question: Jesus, there she goes again! We gotta feed her something.
answer: Yeah, well you just don't feed a baby. First you gotta look and see if she has any teeth or not.

question: Why?
answer: To figure out how old she is so we know what to feed her, that's why. Peter attempts to look into Mary's mouth but she squirms.

question: Do you look on top or bottom?
answer: How do I know?

question: Try feeling with your finger. Peter slides his finger over Mary's gums.
answer: I can't feel anything -- I'll give her the stuff for newborns and hope she's not allergic to it. Peter starts off toward the kitchen, Michael follows. And then we'll have to see if she's allergic to iron, to soy or to milk -- you can't imagine how much stuff they can be allergic to!

question: She's soaking wet -- did you buy any diapers?
answer: Diapers?

question: Excuse me, miss, could you tell me which diapers are the most absorbent?
answer: I would suggest the ones that say 'ultra-absorbent.'

question: Yeah, but which are better
answer: Depends how much your baby weighs.

question: Oh right, how much she weighs...
answer: You wouldn't happen to have a friend who came in here a little while ago, would you? Michael grabs just any box of diapers.

question: I have no idea what you're talking about! He's no friend of mine. Michael takes off very, very quickly.
answer: Oh shit, my slacks! Goddamn her, she took a crap! Hold her. Hold her, goddamn it!

question: I can't hold her. This kid's out of control here!
answer: Just gimme the cotton. Michael lets go of Mary's feet and she sticks them back in the crap. Oh for chrissake, don't just let go of her!

question: Then get the cotton yourself if you don't want me to let go of her! Peter grabs a huge wad of cotton.
answer: Take the towels off -- They're full of shit.

question: But the couch'll get dirty!
answer: Yeah, but she keeps getting it all over herself. Man, this shit is sticky!... We need cleaning fluid or something to get it off...

question: How 'bout after-shave?
answer: Are you kidding?! Waste our Saint Laurent on babyshit?

question: Okay, let's just put the diaper
answer: Right. Michael hands him a diaper. Peter tries to figure out how it goes on. These tape things -- do they go on the front or the back?

question: How am I supposed to know...? Peter tries to slide the diaper under Mary's backside but she squirms and kicks it off with her feet.
answer: Hold her under her arms -- I'm gonna try it this way. Michael holds Mary under her armpits. Peter tries to put the diaper on her. It's hard. What's more, it would seem that Michael didn't buy the right size -- The diaper comes all the way up to Mary's chin. What the hell kind of lousy stinking diapers did you get? They're way too big!

question: I don't think they're too big -- They're ultra-absorbent. That's all. The more absorbent the better. Peter has more or less managed to adjust the diaper.
answer: How the hell do these tape things work? Hold her for chrissakes!

question: My arms are getting tired.
answer: There. I got it. He tapes the diaper closed. Damn it. I didn't make it tight enough.

question: It's not working... What about laying her down?
answer: Go ahead... No, not on the towels, they're all covered with crap... Michael lays Mary down right on the couch. Peter vigor- ously undoes the tape, and the whole PLASTIC lining RIPS apart. ... What the hell is this friggin' mess? Oh, man, this is unbelievable! To think, they bombard us day and night with their goddamn TV commercials! And will you look at this junk? This stuff is pure shit -- You tape it closed, it sags, you undo the tape

question: Well, whaddya expect, if you pull on it like an ape, it's gonna rip!
answer: Michael, will you give me a break, will you please? Peter takes the torn diaper off. MARY utters a TINY CRY and pees copiously all over the velvet couch. Oh shit! Now she's pissing. Look at the couch. The sneaky little bitch was just waiting for me to get the diaper off, then whammo... Mary gives them a big smile. I happen to like my furniture. I'm going out to get some real diapers. You can clean the couch up in the meantime. He exits, slamming the door. I need to reach Jack Collins, he's one of your pilots... No, I don't know exactly where he is, but he was supposed to be flying the Miami-Caracas-Rio route... The guy who proposed to you?... Oh, did he?... Well, congratulations. Please... listen to me... you must contact him and tell him he's got to call home immediately. Okay? It's an emergency, a family problem... No, don't worry, he's not married to someone else. It's another kind of family Maybe she's allergic to something?

question: Or maybe she's hungry again.
answer: Already?

question: Make it snappy, will ya, she's famished.
answer: Oh shit, she's soaking wet again.

question: Oh no you're not, you're not gonna leave me alone with her.
answer: I told you -- I have a date.

question: You rotten bastard -- do you see me going out on any dates?
answer: Look, it's with Natalie -- I've been after her for months already.

question: So what! If you leave me alone with this kid, I swear I'll pack up and be outta here by morning.
answer: You're a real drag, y'know? Tonight was gonna be my big night! Now I bet it's gonna be Carl's big night. Hello, Natalie? It's Peter. Listen, I'm really screwed. Jerry just called and we've run into a snag with the blueprints for the competition, it's an emergency. I've gotta go over to the office right away, I think it's gonna be an all-nighter... Of course I didn't know about this yesterday -- he just called me. Mary reaches out and begins to jab the buttons on the phone. Peter pulls her back. Hello? Hello?... No, I'm not trying to hang up on you. We're having some problems with the phone, that's all... No, Natalie, there's no one else here! You're the only woman I... I swear I'm not lying to you... What? You're going to call Carl? Okay, go ahead, call him if you want. I don't give a shit... Of course I'm not jealous. What makes you think I'm jealous? Jerry, hi, it's Peter. Listen, I've run into some problems, I can't make it today... ... Hey, take it easy, will you... I'm sick. Seriously ill. I'm burning up... The doctor had to come, I've gotta stay in bed till Friday. Hey, hey, hey, I'll work round the clock all weekend long... I swear, Jerry, I am not lying to you...

question: I'm terribly sorry, Mr. Oxman, but I've run into a few problems, I won't be able to bring you the drawings tomorrow morning as I On second thought, Mr. Oxman... uh, better make that the end of next week. Please don't get upset, Mr. Oxman. I'll do everything possible to get them to you sooner... You have my word... I apologize again, Mr. Oxman... Thank you again, Mr. Oxman. Goodb... ... Mr. Oxman? Hello, Mr. Oxman? He didn't say what time?
answer: All he said was Thursday.

question: Terrific! -- We could rot here till eight o'clock tonight.
answer: Well, I'm prepared to rot here till midnight if I have to, as long as we get rid of her.

question: Jack really could have called. He has to have gotten our message by now.
answer: Well, when he does call, I'm gonna let him have it! That sonofabitch is on the beaches of Brazil proposing to the whole goddamn world. And we're here living in hell! He's gonna get his ass on the next plane back here. Vacation's over, Jack-baby, you better believe it.

question: Damn right! It's almost time for her bottle, you know.
answer: Oh hell!

question: We came for the package.
answer: Package? Oh that's cute, referring to her as a package! Anyway, you can tell Sylvia she's a lousy stinking bitch.

question: Sylvia?
answer: Yeah, Sylvia! You can tell her she's got a hell of a nerve dumping her problems into our laps!

question: Problems? Did you guys have trouble?
answer: Do you have any idea what it's been like around here for the past four days?

question: What the hell is that? A baby?
answer: No, it's a very short teenager. Of course it's a baby! Now listen carefully

question: Oh! I get it! Powdered milk! Very clever!
answer: Yeah, right... real clever... Okay, here. She's all yours. Good luck.

question: Okay, I got it. You can take her out now.
answer: Take what out? I'm not taking anything out.

question: Wait a minute, I don't get it! We take the basket and the milk, that's all. We ain't gonna take the... what's inside.
answer: Whadda ya mean, what's inside?

question: You take it all, man! It's a package deal!
answer: But what are we s'posed to do with it?

question: How do I know? You take it where they told you to take it.
answer: Y'mean, I take it to the connection?

question: Yeah, whatever you want to call it.
answer: Are you sure that's the plan?

question: You bet that's the plan! We're not keeping her one more second.
answer: Okay, if that's the plan... He passes the basket to Punk #2 ... Here, hold this. Okay, so long! They start to leave, pressing the elevator button.

question: Aah, relief at last! Good riddance!
answer: You said it! Now maybe I can get some work done. He disappears in the direction of his room. Peter is sitting on something hard. He pulls it out from under him, it's a package. He looks at it, casually reading

question: What the hell is this?
answer: Well, a package, I guess.

question: Was this package delivered to you?
answer: Yeah, why? Peter raises his voice, exasperated by Michael's calm attitude.

question: When the hell did this package arrive?
answer: Will you quit shouting!

question: When did this fucking package fucking arrive, Michael?
answer: I don't know... Oh yeah, Sunday -- Mrs. Razzolini brought it up...

question: Holy shit!
answer: What's the matter?

question: This is the package those guys came for, not the baby, you asshole.
answer: Hey, asshole yourself!... Oh shit! Peter nods and begins to bark orders.

question: We'd be better off taking the subway.
answer: You want to ride the subway with a hundred grand in uncut dope, go ahead.

question: Well we can't ride around carrying this baby basket. We'll get stopped by the cops.
answer: So go ahead, take the subway and stop bothering me. I'm going to hook this onto the back seat.

question: It'll never hold, man.
answer: Goddamn hook! Christ, what a stupid idea hiding the shit with this kid. It's ridiculous! Peter comes rushing out of the building.

question: Goddamn hook! Christ, what a stupid idea hiding the shit with this kid. It's ridiculous! Peter comes rushing out of the building.
answer: Oh, thank God, you're still here! There's been a terrible mistake. That wasn't the package you were s'posed to take. It was another one. I have it right here.

question: What do you mean? What other package?
answer: I'll take the basket back and give you the other package, here. No mistake. Peter takes the package from his pocket and is about to grab the basket. Punk #1 pushes him back violently.

question: You ain't takin' nothin' back, man.
answer: But I'm tellin you it was a mistake...

question: You tryin' to double-cross us or something? Beat it before I get pissed, man.
answer: But I'm telling you, I've got your package right here. There's been a mistake...

question: A mistake my ass! Now get outa here, man, or I'm gonna stick this right in your gut. Start the bike. Punk #2 is about to get on the motorcycle. Peter stops him.
answer: But I'm telling you, I've got the real package in my pocket.

question: Freeze! All right, asshole, let's see some I.D.
answer: Listen, Officer, let's stay calm now. I haven't the slightest intention of running. I am not a criminal. I'm an architect.

question: (calming down
answer: I'm terribly sorry, Officer, but I don't have any identification on me. I just came down with my baby to run a quick errand. I haven't committed any crime.

question: All right, let's go, in the car. I'm taking you down to the station.
answer: Oh, c'mon, that's impossible -- you see I have a baby. I have to give her a bottle in fifteen minutes, I can't go anywhere. I live right in this building -- let me go up to my apartment and I'll get you my license immediately... You can even come with me if you like...

question: Hey, what's happening? What were those cops doing... Peter shuts him up, grabs him roughly under the arm and leads him into his room, closing the door behind them. Peter speaks softly but he's totally freaking out, he can hardly breathe.
answer: Michael... Michael... we're in deep trouble. The package... The package...

question: Yeah? What?
answer: There's a cop on the doorstep... He didn't see you... He mustn't see you... We're in deep trouble, Michael...

question: Tell me what...
answer: The package they came for wasn't the baby, it was dope, drugs, a shitload of dope! We were stopped by some cops down on the street.

question: But did the cops see the dope?
answer: No, it's right here.

question: Shit!
answer: We'll get twenty years if the cops find this on us! Climb down the fire escape and hide it... anywhere! Michael takes the package, opens the window and starts to climb out it when Peter stops him. Hey, whatever you do, don't lose the goddamn dope, we gotta be able to return it to those dealers or we're dead. Those guys are serious.

question: Don't worry. He starts down the fire escape, then stops and turns back. Oh, by the way, I put some water up to boil for her bottle. Michael disappears. Peter picks up Mary, grabs his wal- let and leaves the room. When he gets to the hall, he discovers that Cop #1 has joined Cop #2, to whom he is whispering something. Peter holds his license out for them to see.
answer: Here's my license.

question: Narcotics squad? What do they want with me? I don't even use aspirin!
answer: Hello, Officers... What's going on?

question: Don't worry, Michael, it's nothing serious, just a little misunderstanding.
answer: Did you give her the 5:30 bottle?

question: Yeah, I just gave it to her.
answer: Did you change her?

question: No, she's soaking wet.
answer: Okay, I'll do it. Michael puts down his bag of groceries, takes Mary from Peter and disappears with the box of diapers. In his room, he lays Mary down on his bed and starts undressing her.

question: And who's he?
answer: He's my roommate.

question: Oh, I see, I see...
answer: No, you don't see. There are three of us sharing this place.

question: Oh, three, huh? A regular 'mirage a trois'!
answer: It's 'menage'... and it's not. We all have lots of girlfriends, thank you.

question: Uh-huh, so what's your friend do?
answer: He's a cartoonist.

question: What about the other guy?
answer: He's a pilot.

question: Ah-hah... Now that's interesting... So does this friend of yours ever fly to South America?
answer: No. Never. Only North America. The PHONE RINGS.

question: Would you object if I answered it for you?
answer: Not at all, go right ahead. I've got nothing to hide. Agent #1 picks up the phone and listens.

question: It's a collect call from a Jack Collins in La Paz, Bolivia. That wouldn't happen to be your pilot friend, would it? The one who never goes to South America?
answer: Yes, it is him. Agent #1 hands him the phone. Hello, yes, operator, I accept the charges. Agent #1 gestures to Agent #3 to take a look around the apartment. Agent #3 slips away.

question: Would you mind very much if I listened?
answer: Please, go right ahead. Agent #1 picks up the other telephone. Hello, Jack? Fine, yeah. How're you? Yeah, he's fine, too. Yeah, we left a message for you, right... No, it was nothing I said everything's fine! The what?... I don't know what you're talking about... Oh yeah, the package! Yeah, yeah, it got here ... and was picked up, uh-huh. Hey! Why didn't you call sooner? Huh? 'Cause what?... Oh, you're onto something hot -- well, aren't you the lucky one!... So when are you getting married?... Forget it, I was just kidding... Well, everything's fine up here. So have a good time. See you in a couple of weeks. 'Bye. Peter hangs up. So does Agent #1.

question: Come back anytime, gentlemen. You're always welcome here. We have no particular plans to leave New York in the near future, so don't worry about us now. 'Bye now. Once the cops are gone, Michael races back to the living room. Peter has collapsed into his armchair.
answer: Christ, what a mess! They'll be on our tails around the clock! How the hell are we gonna get rid of the goddamn dope?! By the way, where is it?

question: It's cool, don't worry, I got it stashed.
answer: Where? Michael points to Mary's bottom. Huh?

question: This way it's close at hand!
answer: Are you out of your mind??

question: Relax, will you. I diapered the dope on her right in front of the cop and he never noticed a thing!
answer: I told the cops we were taking care of her. You realize we're now stuck with the kid till Jack

question: Wait a minute. You're not gonna stick me with this kid! Tell them you need a maternity leave, tell them anything, but we've got to go 50-50 on this!
answer: And that's not all -- we haven't heard from the punks yet either! That's right, you heard right ... Goddammit, Jerry, of course winning the competition is important to me! The firm's my whole life if you must know. No, no, please -- don't send anyone over here... Don't you come either. No, Jerry... Okay, listen, I'll be there in a half-hour, but I can't stay long. No! Don't come here! I'll be right over. He hangs up. Michael enters the room, with his coat on. You're going now?

question: Yeah, but don't worry about it, I'll be back before it's time for her next bottle. She's asleep now.
answer: Terrific, just terrific! Jerry just called

question: Well, call him back. Tell him you'll come later.
answer: There's no way. I can't, he's suicidal. Why don't you call Oxman and tell him you'll be there in a few hours.

question: You're crazy. Oxman is leaving in an hour. If I don't meet him before then, I blow my 15,000 dollar contract.
answer: Oh shit, I can't take this anymore!

question: Look, maybe we could pawn her off on Mrs. Razzolini, just for a couple of hours -- she's crazy about her!
answer: Good idea! Let's go.

question: Just as I thought -- the goddamn cops are grilling Mrs. Razzolini.
answer: Oh shit! We sure as hell can't hand her the baby with an ass full of dope... right in front of the narcs! The elevator has arrived meanwhile. What should we do? I really gotta go...

question: Listen, she's just had her bottle. She's sleeping like a log. Let's just leave her in the apartment. What can possibly happen to her? She's as regular as clockwork. She won't wake up till 8:30 and we'll easily be back by then...
answer: Yeah, you're right, we won't be long. They rush into the elevator. Michael? Michael, are you here? No answer. Peter pushes the door open. The sight that greets his eyes is very dismaying. It looks like a tornado has hit the house. Everything's on the floor, it's all been smashed, it's all been ripped apart. Gone is the beauti- ful apartment that had been so lovingly decorated. In its place, utter devastation and shambles. Peter stands there speechless for a moment, then an awful thought crosses his mind. He runs like crazy into his room -- the basket's not there. Stepping over the debris and all the things strewn over the floor, he rushes into the living room, then into Michael's room. The basket's nowhere to be seen. Peter falls apart; without even realizing it, he's moan- ing and muttering distractedly. He runs into Jack's room, into the kitchen, into the bathroom. The basket is nowhere to be seen. Peter runs all over, back and forth ten times in all the rooms. Tears are flowing from his eyes. Suddenly, he hears FAINT CRIES. They're coming from the back bathroom. Peter rushes to it, practically ripping the door from its hinges. There on the toilet is the basket, and on it there's a note written in big messy printing which says

question: Oh, really? Well, if I were you I'd get myself some new friends! Peter comes in, in his bathrobe, furious.
answer: What the hell are you guys looking for, anyway?

question: Probably the same things your friends were looking for last night! Didn't Mrs. Razzolini bring you a package last Sunday?
answer: You mean the chocolate Easter bunnies? We ate them already. He starts to walk away. Anyway, you have no idea how many packages we've been getting lately. It's hard to keep track of them.

question: Maybe we can help. Let's get to work! All the cops enter the apartment.
answer: My pleasure. Try not to make a mess. Be my guest.

question: Did you hear that? He said there'd been a mistake and they weren't going to bother us anymore.
answer: Bullshit, it's a trick.

question: You think so? Really?
answer: They just said that to put us off guard. They saw the condition this apartment's in. They know the punks were here looking for the dope and that they probably didn't find it. So that means we've still got it.

question: But he said the investigation was closed.
answer: Okay, let's just see how closed it is. I'll go downstairs. You watch out the window and see if I'm being tailed. So? Was I right?

question: There's one guy for sure! A redhead, kind of young, disguised sort of like a college student.
answer: I knew it. They're going to be watching us around the clock.

question: I have the feeling they'll come to us.
answer: We'll have to be very careful.

question: Hello? Who? Goddamn it, where are you?... ... It's Jack. He just landed in Newark. He came back early.
answer: Gimme that. Jack? What the hell are you doing? Yeah... yeah... oh yeah? Well, listen very carefully, Jack. That wonderful, fantastic babe you brought back from Bolivia? The one you're gonna marry tomorrow? Well, you're not going to bring her here!... You are going to say 'goodbye' to her very nicely and put her in a cab back to Bolivia... Why? Because there's another wonderful, fantastic babe waiting for you right here at home ... Who is she? Oh, that's a surprise! You'll see when you get here. But believe me, she's

question: Make it quick, the punks may be trying to call...
answer: So hurry home, Jack, this little doll can't wait to see you. 'Bye. He hangs up. That goddamn mother fuckin' jerk of an asshole! I swear when he comes through the door I'll kill him! I'll... The PHONE interrupts. Michael leaps up and answers it.

question: Hello? Listen, tomorrow, Central Park at the fountain near the merry-go-round, five o'clock. Be there, but... They've hung up on the other end. Michael hangs up and sits down, drained. ... That was it.
answer: All we can do now is hope our plan works.

question: You think the cops have our phone bugged?
answer: I don't think that's legal, is it?

question: First, we've got the narcs on our ass, then there's the drug gang threatening to carve us up. Then bottles... bottles... every three hours, bottles.
answer: And diapers. Have you ever tried to do diapers?

question: 'La Paz, Bolivia...' He calls from ... 'I'm onto something hot.' He says. 'Did the package get there?' He says. You asshole!
answer: And the day they wrecked the apartment, Peter came home and couldn't find Mary. I've never seen him in tears like that bef...

question: Okay, he's coming out alone. I'll follow him. Someone else stay here to keep an eye on the other guys.
answer: What's going on?

question: Inspector Graton, Narcotics. Do you admit you gave these men this package?
answer: Sure. I gave it to them, just a moment ago.

question: Officer, will you please open this package in front of these witnesses? The cop opens the package
answer: Is it against the law to give a box of candy to my friends? Peter and Jack take off their glasses.

question: Crawl. Listen, Sylvia, you've got to come back. I travel, I can't take care of her... Yeah, but you're her mother... I'm her father -- what makes you so sure I'm the father!? The dates coincide! Big deal! That doesn't prove a thing... But she's still your kid, so do me a favor, get your ass back here immediately and take her off our hands... 'Cause we've got a lot better things to do with our lives than wipe a baby's ass, okay? Sylvia?... Hello! Hello! Sylvia, goddam it! Shit! That bitch hung up on me! Women! I could kill them!
answer: Why don't you call her back?

question: I don't have the number. I got a message to her through her agency, they won't tell me where she is. I don't even know where she was calling from. And you better believe she's not going
answer: Hello?... No, it's Michael... How are you?... Oh, she's doing just fine, she's in great shape. We're taking very good care of her, you have nothing to worry about. 'Bye. He hangs up.

question: Who was that?
answer: Sylvia -- She wanted to know how Mary was doing.

question: What? Jesus Christ, Michael, why didn't you let me talk to her!?
answer: She would have just hung up on you again. The important thing is she knows Mary's fine.

question: You jerk! You should've said she was terrible, sick as hell! Practically on death's door! What a jerk, what a pain in the ass you can be sometimes...
answer: What's with him? The kid's doing really great!

question: Mom? Hi, how are you?... Yes, I'm fine. Yes, I'm eating well. Mom, how would you feel if I told you you were a grandma?... SCREAMING coming over the phone. ... Yeah... A little girl, Mary... SCREAMING coming over the phone. ... I'd love you to see her. In fact, I was gonna bring her down tomorrow... today?... Great, I think there's a flight in three hours. I'll be at your place by two. See you real soon! He hangs up gleefully, rubbing his hands together.
answer: You'll have four already made, this'll hold till Miami.

question: Okay...
answer: Tell her to make sure Mary gets plenty of sleep.

question: I'll tell her.
answer: If her ass gets red, tell her not to listen to any pediatricians -- they're full of shit.

question: Right. Full of shit.
answer: Then she should give her a bottle of water instead of the regular bottle. Works like a charm

question: Bottle of water, white as snow...
answer: Peter says her clothes should be washed by hand...

question: Really, by hand?
answer: And only in soap flakes without any artificial color or scent. And then rinsed three times in very hot water.

question: Rinse three times.
answer: To put her to sleep we sing in harmony -- it always works.

question: My mother lives alone.
answer: Solo works just as well.

question: Okay.
answer: Now, as for the nipples, you've got to be very, very, very careful. As soon as the hole gets too big she's gotta throw them out -- This is extra, extra, extra-specially important -- 'cause if the hole's too big, the milk comes out too fast and it's bad for her digest...

question: Anyone home? Michael is in the living room, eating a sandwich, while looking through a magazine.
answer: I am!

question: How 'bout Jack?
answer: On his way to Miami.

question: Oh, yeah. He's got a lot of nerve! Leaving us with the kid again...
answer: No, he took Mary to his mother's, she couldn't wait to see her. He's gonna try to unload her on her till Sylvia gets back. I made her four bott...

question: You're kidding! That son-of-a- bitch!
answer: Don't worry, I told him everything he had to know, and I made her four bott...

question: Oh, I'm telling you, that guy is really starting to get on my nerves!
answer: Why?

question: Goddamn him! He really could have called me!
answer: Are you pissed off 'cause she's gone?

question: Of course not! What, are you crazy? I'm relieved! Thank God she's out of here!
answer: I made her four bott... Four bottles for the goddam trip. There, I finally got it out.

question: Hey, Mom!
answer: Hey, he finally made it! Do you have any idea what time it is? It's four. You said two.

question: But, Mom, I missed the plane.
answer: Yeah, but now I have to go.

question: Where are you going?
answer: On a cruise around the world.

question: But why didn't you say so on the phone?
answer: Because you never would've come. Now let me see her. Oh, my little strudle! Bye-bye, sweetie love... I'll bring you back presents from all over the world. Four o'clock. She runs into the car and they pull away. Everyone waving goodbye.

question: 'Bye!
answer: You're bringing her back?

question: Yeah... she's starving. I gotta heat this bottle up right away. They go into the kitchen together. Peter immediately gets busy; he heats the bottle up quickly while Jack soothes the hungry Mary by carrying her in his arms.
answer: So what happened? Did you two have a fight?

question: Goddamn cruises...
answer: Didn't she want to take her?

question: Well, she wants to see her anyway! He heads toward Peter's room.
answer: What do you want?

question: Nothing, nothing.
answer: Don't go into my room, she's asleep.

question: Yeah, but the nanny, Mrs. Bretsaws, she wants to see her.
answer: No, damn it, no! You're gonna wake her up! It already took me an hour to sing her to sleep...

question: Yeah, but she wants to see her.
answer: All right, I'll go explain the situation.

question: No, no, Peter, please, really, don't go, don't bother, I'll go explain it to her myself...
answer: It's no bother, Jack. I'll be glad to do it. He rushes toward the living room.

question: Wanna bet she's out of here in ten minutes slamming the door behind her? They tiptoe over to the living room door and eavesdrop.
answer: ... A sleeping child should not be awakened. If you don't know that, then you're not fit to be a nanny.

question: ... A sleeping child should not be awakened. If you don't know that, then you're not fit to be a nanny.
answer: I never said that I wanted the child to be awakened, sir. I only asked to see her. If I'm going to be taking care of the child on a round-the-clock basis, then...

question: 'Round-the-clock'? Whaddya mean 'round the clock'? Are you intending to sleep here?
answer: Absolutely, sir. A second mommy is a second mommy.

question: And where are you going to sleep?
answer: Well, I expect you to show me to my quarters.

question: Well, I don't know where Jack intends to stick you... That's his problem... Maybe in his room... But I'm warning you, Mrs. Brestshow.
answer: Bretsaws.

question: There are three of us sharing this place and we're all real studs.
answer: ... And as for screwing, I have all I need at home, thank you very much. With a few days off every month, I'm sure I'll be fine. The only thing I'm interested in is the care of the child and I can tell she needs some.

question: Oh, yeah? How do you figure that?
answer: Shouldn't I be discussing all this with the father?

question: Well, listen, Mrs. Fretsaw, umm... Brainsore...
answer: Bretsaws, Mrs. Bretsaws.

question: Right... Bratsnot, lemme tell you something. With a child you always know who the mother is, but the father -- that's another kettle of fish. So don't give me that bullshit, okay?
answer: Very well. I won't discuss it any further with you. Will you please show me where the kitchen and the bathroom are?

question: What for?
answer: So I can make you a list of the things we need.

question: What do you mean, make you a list? -- Don't you do the shopping yourself?
answer: No shopping or laundry or housekeeping. I am a professional nanny.

question: We have plenty of everything.
answer: Do you have a sufficient amount of fruit and vegetables for the child?

question: She only eats milk and cereal.
answer: That's not enough, sir. From the age of three months children should be started on a normal, varied diet.

question: Oh that's bullshit. You don't feed a baby like an adult.
answer: Oh, really? And how would you know?

question: I've read plenty of books. The diet recommended by those quack pediatricians today is way too rich. I'm in favor of natural methods, Mrs. Breathmint.
answer: Bretsaws, Mrs. Bretsaws.

question: For instance, if a child is having trouble getting to sleep, what would you do?
answer: Depends, if it was a continuing problem, I might recommend a mild sedative...

question: I knew you'd say something like that, you jerk!
answer: Fine. Anything you say, sir. Let me just remind you that I have my diploma and that medicine is a serious matter.

question: Do you know the song that goes 'Medicine's a whore and the pharmacist is her pimp'?
answer: No, I don't. We must listen to different music. Personally I'm very fond of opera.

question: Mrs. Breakballs, if you don't get out of here right this minute I'm gonna punch you in the nose! This is my home, now get out!
answer: The name's Bretsaws. I am blessed with infinite patience when it comes to children, sir, but I'm not qualified to deal with lunatics. Goodbye and good luck! Mrs. Bretsaws grabs her suitcase and exits, dignified and stiff as a broom, slamming the door behind her.

question: Hey, horny yourself! I don't give a shit. I don't need you guys. I'll find some other way to do it. And I won't take the New York-Washington shuttle! He exits, furious.
answer: Hi, Jack, something wrong?

question: Oh, hi... Nah, nothing's wrong.
answer: What were you doing in the boss's office?

question: I was asking to do the New York- Washington shuttle for a few months.
answer: Oh, and he said 'no,' huh?

question: As a matter of fact, he said 'yes.' Paul backs up against the wall, protecting his face with his arms. Jack leaves, disgusted. Paul watches him go, totally confused. Okay, I'm off. She's well fed and she's sleeping now. We hear MARY CRYING. Shit, she's crying. I'll go pick her up... Peter passes him in the corridor. He, too, is ready to go out to his office. No, she needs to burp -- I've gotta rock her for a little...
answer: I'm telling you, the more you pick her up, the longer it'll take her to get to sleep.

question: Thanks for the advice -- now why don't you just shove it? I know you let her scream for hours but I can't.
answer: I never let her scream for hours!

question: You'd resort to any theory to not take care of her. Just because you've read some books...
answer: Can you believe what he just said to me... I read those books bec...

question: Come on, guys, cool it! It's my shift now. I'll rock her for a few minutes... ... and then I'll put her right to bed. So off to work, both of you. He pushes them both out. Coochie, coochie, coo... woo, woo, woo... bippity, boppity boo... Peter comes rushing into the apartment and runs toward his room. He stops short in the corridor -- he hears Mary's laughter and Michael's coochie-coo's. Noiselessly he tiptoes over to the living room door and listens, troubled. Then he walks away and shouts, as though he were just coming out of his room.
answer: Hi, Michael, I just came back to get a file I forgot... Everything okay?

question: Yeah, okay. Silence.
answer: Well, I guess I'll be going now.

question: Yeah... They're both uneasy.
answer: The baby okay?

question: Why do you always have to bring Carl along with you?
answer: Don't you like him?

question: Oh, c'mon -- I love him! Only, I'd like to see you alone for once, that's all.
answer: He's extremely talented -- in fact, I hate to tell you this, but I think he and his group are gonna win the competition.

question: What?
answer: We were just saying that this baby's conversation is actually rather limited... and a touch annoying. Don't you think?

question: Well, she's not the only one with a limited conversation. At least she has an excuse, she's a baby! What's yours?
answer: I frankly don't know what you mean.

question: Ta-da! Will you look at this? Is this a cake or what? Can someone make a little room on the table so I can... Are you guys leaving?
answer: Yeah, we're beat.

question: Hey, where is everybody?
answer: Sorry about the cake, Mike... It looks great!

question: Oh, never mind, don't worry... Good night... Jerry and his Wife exit. Michael is left standing there with his cake. Jack comes in, full of beans.
answer: Well, she's asleep at last! We sang in har... Hey, where is everybody?

question: Gone. Can you make a little room for me on the table to put the...
answer: You mean they're all gone?

question: Yeah, all of 'em, hey, can you make a little room for me to...
answer: Peter! Peter, goddamit, get out here! Peter comes back in with Jack. They're all gone!

question: Hello... I'm Sylvia, Mary's mother. I've come to get her...
answer: Oh, it's you... Wait, I'll go

question: How's Mary doing?
answer: Fine, fine, she's doing great... She's getting her back teeth in lately, it's been a bit rough...

question: Can I see her?
answer: Oh, yeah, sure, she's in there... They both enter the living room. Mary stares at Sylvia. When she spots Mary, Sylvia suddenly breaks down in tears. Peter is dumbfounded.

question: I don't believe how much she's grown! Recovering, wiping away her tears, she walks over to the playpen. Hello, Mary, hello my darling... She picks her up, hugs her tightly, showers kisses on her. MARY LAUGHS. Sylvia starts crying again. How beautiful she is... Her hair has grown... Look how much she changed, I missed it all. I missed her so much! Peter, in a kind of daze, stares at Sylvia. Without looking at Peter, she dries her eyes and tries to stop crying. I wanted to make life difficult for Jack but I never thought I'd miss her so much...
answer: Oh, yeah... make life difficult for Jack...

question: Is he here?
answer: What?

question: Is Jack here?
answer: Oh, yeah, yeah, I'll go get him... He exits like a sleepwalker and goes straight into Michael's room. The latter is asleep. Michael, Michael... Sylvia's here. Michael wakes up and looks at Peter. Mary's leaving.

question: Here are the bibs. Jack told me to give them...
answer: Thanks... I put the woolen things on the bottom and the diapers and lighter things on top, because you'll need those first...

question: Yeah, sure... Michael bustles about. Sylvia's gaze comes to rest on the crib which stands imposingly in the middle of the living room. Music boxes, little booties and stuffed animals are hanging from the bars, and a pretty white tulle frames the crib.
answer: You'll have to come back and get the crib later.

question: You really screwed us over but good -- you know that...
answer: I know, I'm sorry.

question: Really. Our lives have been out of control for the past six months.
answer: Yeah, I bet... Actually, that was kind of the point... But I'm the one who really got screwed... She starts to cry again.

question: Don't cry, c'mon... you're taking her back now, it's great...
answer: Yeah, it's great...

question: D'you have enough money? Can you manage all right?
answer: Yeah, sure... I'm not loaded, but it's okay -- I'm working, I've got modeling jobs lined up...

question: Do you have a boyfriend?
answer: No. That's the last thing I need. I've got my work. And now I've got her. She rubs noses with Mary. Peter and Michael approach.

question: She'll figure it out by herself...
answer: Yeah, she'll manage...

question: Now it's back to the good life for us!
answer: Sleeping late! Different women every night! I can't wait!

question: Hey, what's the matter with you?
answer: Whadda you mean, what's the matter with me?

question: Are you sick?
answer: Me? No. I'm fine.

question: C'mon, Jack! Didn't you see who we've got on board today?
answer: Sure I did, why?

question: Well... look...
answer: So it's the Rockettes, so what?

question: And you're just sitting there like that?
answer: Whaddaya mean, sitting there? I happen to be getting ready to fly this airplane.

question: Hi...
answer: Hi?

question: Don't you recognize me?
answer: Wait... uh, no...

question: I'm the one who was tailing you... Remember, in the park...
answer: Oh, yeah, the park... the diaper and all...

question: That's it, the diaper... But don't worry. This isn't an investigation, I left the force four months ago, and anyway, they've arrested the whole gang since then... I just wanted to ask you something...
answer: Have you noticed? I'm pregnant.

question: Oh yeah, I see...
answer: So, shall we go for a walk?

question: There's something I have to know...
answer: Wouldn't you like to be pregnant?

question: What? Oh sure... maybe... no... I dunno... Look, there's been something bothering me for a long time.
answer: You see, if I was God, and I could create the world all over again, here's what I would do

question: Really? That's an interesting idea... Actually, I just wanted to ask you...
answer: At least that way things would have been clearer to begin with, y'see. They wouldn't have made us believe that somebody could come out of our rib, y'know? 'Cause nothing ever comes out of our rib, y'know? Ever. Only out of our prick, and even then ... Everything still has to be done after that.

question: That's for sure...
answer: What we men know how to make is planes, buildings, cars, and all that stuff... It's useful, mind

question: It's driving me crazy! This thing keeps going around and around in my head...
answer: And you know what, it's not even like they wanted us to believe it -- it might have been us who wanted to believe it... But let's face it, nobody comes out of our rib...

question: Was the dope in the diaper, yes or no?
answer: Still, that's hard to take, goddam it!

question: Was it in the diaper, or not?
answer: The dope? It was in the diaper, why?

question: Oh, thanks a lot. I feel so much better now. Here, this is a rabbit for your baby. Thanks again, 'bye, I'm so happy. Graton goes off, floating on cloud nine.
answer: But wait -- the baby's gone... Tomorrow, San Francisco!

question: I'll be back the day after tomorrow.
answer: You'll be id a foul bood -- jet lag really wipes out you dow.

question: Whaddya mean, now?
answer: Yeah

question: Before what?
answer: How would I dow? 'Before,' that's all.

question: Hi. Is Sylvia in?
answer: No, she'll be back in a couple of hours -- around midnight, she said...

question: Oh.
answer: Wanna come in and wait for her?

question: Sure... Why not? Sylvia doing okay?
answer: I don't know -- I'm a med student. I'm just babysitting. I only met her a couple hours ago.

question: Oh, I see... Silence. The Young Man sits down at the table and immerses himself in his books. Mary doesn't look up from her pack of cigarettes anymore. Listen, on second thought, I don't think I'll wait for her. Just give her this when she gets back, okay? And this is for the baby. Jack hands the bouquet and the rabbit to the Young Man, who plops them down on a chair.
answer: Sure, no problem. He immerses himself again in his books. Jack heads toward the door, then turns around.

question: Shouldn't the baby be in bed by now?
answer: Yeah... I don't know... When I put her to bed she cries so I just let her stay up...

question: Don't you have any tights to put on her legs?
answer: Tights?... Well, it's pretty hot in here anyway...

question: You want me to call them?
answer: No.

question: But you've got to let them know!
answer: No, I'm not going anywhere anymore, I've had it with traveling. I quit.

question: C'mon, I'll call you a cab, you've still got time.
answer: Don't you call anybody.

question: But the plane's s'posed to take off in half an hour -- They won't have time to replace you. This is serious -- you'll lose your job and you won't be able to pay your share of the apartment anymore... you... Jack takes off his pilot's jacket and throws it aside.
answer: I'll be a dishwasher, I'll live in a flophouse.

question: What the hell happened?
answer: I'm not going, I told you; I'm not going ever again. I'm sick and tired of traveling, sick and tired of broads. They all have the same asses and I can't seem to love them anyway. I can't take another hotel room, and swimming pools and trendy restaurants! I want to know

question: Come on, I made us a good dinner. I bought some filet mignon and Haagen-Dazs butter pecan. When Peter comes back he'll cheer you up...
answer: He's been here all day.

question: He has? I didn't hear him...
answer: He's in his room.

question: 'Cause my place is tiny, y'know, and my schedule's insane -- and I just finished four days of posing and we ended up every day at... Yeah, y'see, Jack, I just did four days of posing...
answer: Yeah...

question: And every day we finished at three in the morning and since Mary always gets up around 5:30...
answer: Yeah...

question: Well, you can imagine how much sleep I've gotten...
answer: Yeah, of course, 'cause after the 5:30 bottle it starts all over again around nine...

question: And by the time I change her and play with her a little, it's already eight o'clock...
answer: And then that's it -- you get only an hour of sleep.

question: And the babysitters till three A.M. -- all my money is sucked
answer: Plus they don't put the kids to bed, they let them lie around half-naked...

question: Oh, so the flowers and the rabbit were from you...
answer: I could have strangled that guy...

question: Really? I can leave her with you for a little while?
answer: Of course. Leave her with us. Come back whenever you want. Get some rest. Sylvia, between two sobs, picks up a big bag beside her on the doorstep.

question: I brought a couple of things for her, just for a few days... Michael eagerly takes the bag from her. It's followed by a second, and then a third. Yeah, it's time for her bottle -- it's all ready in the bag...
answer: I'll go heat up some water right away. Would you like a cup of coffee?
